review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Blue ShadowSize: 256GBStyle: Flip7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: The form factor is the best. The screen works fine. I have had four Samsung flip phones. The ability to put it in your front pocket and still sit down is great. How easy it is to hold in your hand and not drop is great. The fact that you just flip it closed and it ends your session is great. The problem is that Samsung and to some extent Android in general have such horrible flaws. With speech to text, Samsung doesn't understand the exact commands they tell you they do. New line, new paragraph, Etc. As I remember, even if you say the word comma, it types that out instead of actually putting in the punctuation. Samsung was told about this by numerous people for the last 4 years or so and they've never addressed it. The result is that almost everybody uses gboard. Theoretically gboard is not as secure. Also, even if you're using gboard as your keyboard, Samsung doesn't allow you to remove theirs. It will capitalize odd words that are sometimes used as names. It will capitalize the first letter of a first name, but not the first letter of the last name that follows. As far as the flip phone goes, check things like resolution of the screen. You'll find that even the main screen is far below normal bar phone screens and even their own s25 Plus. So it's a mixed bag. If you don't use dictation it can probably be wonderful because of the form factor and because you get a very big screen when it's open. If you use dictation, forget about it.  I am switching to another phone. If Samsung and or Android we get there act together when it comes to dictation, I would stick with it. Of course that is if they would stop lying and saying it'll be fixed in a couple of weeks or it will be fixed with the next update.

span: Buy at your own risk of frustration
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Blue ShadowSize: 512GBStyle: Flip7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: This is the 3rd Samsung ZFlip phones I've had.  Started with the Z flip 4, and the screen went black from the center of the fold out to the edge.  It progressed so you could see no phone, but it still worked if you knew where to poke the black screen.  Took it to the phone repair shop and they replaced all the guts on it.  This happened on month 4 of owning it.  That phone bricked at 14 months, so I bought another z flip s4.  It lasted just over a year and started running super slow,  If I swiped on the screen it was in super slow motion.  That is when I bought the z flip 7 on July 24, 2025.  I didn't even open the box until mid-August.  Now it's been a month, and the inside main screen has gone black again. It is under warantee, so it's going to the shop tomorrow.  But I will never buy another Samsung Z flip again.  I thought it was cool, and safer to not break the screen, but it has not been a good fit.  I'm in my late 60s, and don't open the dang thing a 1000 times a day.  Jeez.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Jet BlackSize: 512GBStyle: Fold7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: I moved from a Apple 12 Pro Max to a new Z 7. I've only had it for three days now but my first impression isn't good. I will say the reason for my purchase was for the large screen. I'm hard of hearing and the screen size is wonderful if you need to use speech to text software. However, at this point I'm very frustrated that ALL apps that I add from Samsung store have advertisements!!!! Apple app downloads never had adds! I'll give another review after a few weeks and see if I can find apps from another location other than Samsung. After getting used to Samsung I'm still not impressed. In my phone book there isn't a map function to see where the address is? Apple made that real easy in the address book also when adding credit cards to the wallet I had to enter all of them manually? So, maybe I'll update my review later.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Jet BlackSize: 512GBStyle: Fold7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Sooo I took a leap and financed this phone then I sat down and was like what am I doing financing a phone !!that's ridiculous!! I am a s24 ultra and note 10 plus person but the idea of a phone being like the old sidekick i was excited,  no it doesn't  slide out but it unfolds that's craziness,  but yeah  for 5 hours of having the zfold  it lost it's coolness and back in the box it went , I'm the s24 folded would be the reason to finance a phone lol, but I drop my phone a lot and here it's still in fantastic shape so yes the zfold is cool but no where near as great as the s24 ultra ! So if u are rich,tech savvy,  and need all that extra stuff the fold if for u , but I don't want to have to use a manual  to use my phone !

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Coral RedSize: 256GBStyle: Flip7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: It is very very fragile... I love this phone so much BUT i have had it a little more then 2 months i have babied the heck out of it. I keep it closed when im not using it. I wipe/blow the screen off before i close it. I wipped the screen of before walking out the door and closing my phone. A crunchy noise happend when my phone closed and when i opened the phone there was a small rock in the corner that cracked the screen and made it unusable in 15 mins... the screan no longer is touchscreen and there are black and green lines all across it. The phone itself is fantastic! i love the charm of it.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Jet BlackSize: 512GBStyle: Fold7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: while the device works great , the center screen breaks too easily just from opening and closing. it also costs  700 Dollars to replace. I have had to replace the screen twice in 4 months.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Jet BlackSize: 512GBStyle: Flip7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: As a user of the Z Flip 5 & 6, I'm impressed by the improved hardware this generation. However, I'm not impressed by a) the cover screen still behaving the way it did 2-3 years ago, and b) the camera quality. Why is the widget selection still so limited to Samsung apps? Why do I need Good Lock to launch apps? Why do I have to open the phone to view notifications in more detail even after installing good lock? Why does my face still look cloudy and washed out when using the main camera sensor? It's a shame Samsung still hasn't figured out the potential of this device. Until I can remote start my car and quickly check my Google Home devices from cover screen widgets, I don't see this phone's form factor being any more beneficial than a slab phone.
a-color-secondary: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2025

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowSize: 512GBStyle: Fold7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Screen started acting funny and stopped working after a month. I love Samsung but this is not it. You can see fold line without phone on and that part seems flimsy. Intent back to my s23 ultra. This was not worth the money.

span: Samsung Galaxy z fold 7 screen does not turn on.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Blue ShadowSize: 256GBStyle: Fold7Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: I ordered the Samsung Galaxy Z fold 7 phone and was delivered on July 19, 2025. Since was travelling to Africa, I decided to keep in the box until I arrive. When I arrived and decided to open the box. It came as a new phone, when I turned it, the front screen could not be turned on. The wide screen turned on, but the phone get hot suddenly with it being used. I am frustrated because I am far my permanent address in the US to send it back.
